ratings.comment: Lectures are somewhat dry, but overall really clear. Exams are long, written essay form but if you attend class you will have everything you need in your notes. He is willing to go back and explain things, and was more than helpful helping me catch up in a class I missed due to interviews.

This professor is somewhat of a dry lecturer. You really need to be at every lecture to really follow whats going on. His tests are all essay, long essay (10-12 pg). Long 15 pg minim term paper, and a current event write up. Honestly I dont like public utilities and if dont love utilities alot you might want a different class. Overall average class

I took it during summer. If you attend class and read lecture notes, take home exam questions are really easy. It just take some times to write the paper since he wants about 10-12 pages. Easy A if you are a "writing" person.

I wish someone had posted him here prior to taking the class.    Power lectures with barely helpful/legible notes on a chalk board.  Probably one of the most boring subjects in the world.  Take home tests are minimum 10 pages 1.5 spaced on vague questions.  Avoid this class!!!  Unless you have a deep love of public utilities. Then go for it.
